title: Vowel Block
text: To solve this problem, treat the vowels (o, u, a, i) as a single entity or "block" since they must form a string.

title: Number of Consonants
text: After treating the vowels as a single block, you have to arrange the consonants and the "vowel block". How many total elements are there?

title: Using the Combination Formula
text: The combination formula is used to calculate the number of ways to choose $$r$$ objects from a set of $$n$$ objects, where the order of selection does not matter.

title: Repetition
text: Only one of the consonants is repeated more than once, how many times is it repeated? The factorial of this will be your denominator in the Combination formula.

title: Number of Vowels
text: How many vowels are in the word?

title: Finding the answer
text: Now, substitute the values into the combination formula, and multiply that by the factorial of the number of vowels to find the answer.
